Description: Compressed spheroidal vase of black-and-white amphibolite: with a high shoulder, broad rim and undercut handles. The groove between the rim and the body was made by sawing, as was the cutting of the handles. Interior moderately well hollowed.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: H. R. Hall, 'British Museum Quarterly' 3 (1928), pl. vb, lower left; G. A. Reisner, 'Mycerinus : the temples of the third pyramid at Giza' (Cambridge, Mass., 1931), 176, type 4-III and fig. 43. no. 4.
